intro: Cryptocarya microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to eastern Australia, particularly found in the regions of New South Wales and Victoria. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are dark green and glossy on top, with a lighter underside. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in spring. The fruit is a small, dark blue drupe that contains a single seed, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
